flawed_nl_solution:
His first drive was 30*0.5=<<30*0.5=51>>51 miles
The next leg was 0.5*2=<<0.5*2=1>>1 hour
The speed of the trip was 30*2=<<30*2=60>>60 mph
So he drove 60*1=<<60=60>>60 miles
So in total he drove 60+51=<<60+51=111>>111 miles

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15.0, not 51.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
